Uses of Interface
xxl.core.io.FilesystemOperations

Packages that use FilesystemOperations
xxl.core.collections.containers.io Provides some containers that are able to store their blocks on disk. 
xxl.core.collections.queues.io The package xxl.core.collections.queues.io provides some implementations of the queue datastructure using special containers (BlockBasedQueue), files (FileStackQueue) or streams (StreamQueue) for storing and receiving the data. 
xxl.core.io Provides classes and routines for system input and output through data streams, serialization, raw i/o and a FAT file system. 
xxl.core.io.fat This part is an implementation of the FAT12/16/32-filesystem based on raw access. 
xxl.core.io.raw Contains classes and interfaces to access raw devices (disks) directly.

Fields in xxl.core.collections.containers.io declared as FilesystemOperations
protected  FilesystemOperations BlockFileContainer.fso
          Contains operations for opening, creating, renaming and deleting files.
 

Constructors in xxl.core.collections.containers.io with parameters of type FilesystemOperations
BlockFileContainer(java.lang.String prefix, FilesystemOperations fso)
          Constructs a BlockFileContainer that consists of existing files given by the specified file name.
BlockFileContainer(java.lang.String prefix, int blockSize, FilesystemOperations fso)
          Constructs an empty BlockFileContainer that is able to store blocks with a maximum size of blockSize bytes.
MultiBlockContainer(java.lang.String prefix, FilesystemOperations fso)
          Constructs a MultiBlockContainer that consists of existing files given by the specified file name.
MultiBlockContainer(java.lang.String prefix, int blockSize, FilesystemOperations fso)
          Constructs an empty MultiBlockContainer that is able to store blocks with a size larger than blockSize bytes.
